name: TheAtlantic
text: "Conventions have long been 'hot'—loud, unsubtle, the political version of infomercials. The Democrats were forced by the pandemic to be cool, and every political gathering from now on will have to reckon with how effective they were" writes @JamesFallows: https://t.co/cmNjAEyvZy

name: TheAtlantic
text: Corporate architecture has taken over, making every city look the same. A more appealing and habitable future would engage with the styles of local people and places, writes @Oniropolis. https://t.co/15ndmnYStS

name: TheAtlantic
text: "With the planet burning, the virus killing, the economy collapsing, and millions of Americans preparing to vote, the country’s leading political cabal has moved into a queasy post-policy space," @AnnieLowrey writes: https://t.co/N2NiKQG4cR

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @davidfrum: The Republican party didn't publish a 2020 platform. But of course it has one. Here it is, in 13 points. https://t.co/NAgDd0ll5v

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: “Even with attention moving on, and opinion polling reverting toward the mean, appalling incidents of police violence continue.” https://t.co/vdYDeoSm1T

name: TheAtlantic
text: Things are already tough for American workers. For some, they may get even tougher. Plus: A new and still-unpublished study describes a case in which a patient contracted COVID-19 twice. What does that really mean? The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/FqGsUqW58b

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdamHSays: My story on night one of the Republican National Convention: https://t.co/wpsAFeInvZ

name: TheAtlantic
text: A series of recent news stories, @megangarber writes, is a testament to the unending influence of "boys will be boys": https://t.co/BYWkBa0O6C

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdamHSays: .@megangarber: "People often argue that the #MeToo movement has been unfair, and that feminism has gone too far, even as many of those who have been accused of wrongdoing remain elevated, celebrated, centered in their power." https://t.co/rPjjBalFEp

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @mckaycoppins: .@AdamHSays makes the key point here: Tim Scott and Nikki Haley are beloved by Republicans who long for a return to the pre-Trump GOP, but they were speaking to  "the fringes of the president’s coalition" last night. 

https://t.co/0VB1pBmcjV

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The question is not why Republicans lack a coherent platform; it’s why they’re so reluctant to publish the one on which they’re running," @davidfrum writes: https://t.co/bVag4Sgqcm

name: TheAtlantic
text: The McCloskeys are avatars for Donald Trump’s pitch to the country: Voters should be scared of what will happen if he is not reelected, @emmaogreen writes: https://t.co/BmoypMFlks

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The fate of America’s democracy may soon rest on whether its people demand democracy or abandon it," @davidlitt writes: https://t.co/w7Cfh8OMw1

name: TheAtlantic
text: Watch live: Join @AtlanticLIVE for an online summit to discuss the challenges facing children today, which will include a panel discussion with @katejulian on the lasting effects of social distancing. https://t.co/npoisOWDo9

name: TheAtlantic
text: Watch live: Join @AtlanticLIVE for an online summit to discuss the challenges facing children today, which will include a panel discussion with @katejulian on the lasting effects of social distancing. https://t.co/e4oh6DIWLT

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Anger at racial injustice makes people eager to do something about it. We cannot suppress anger, nor should we dress it up in the garments of respectability politics," @myishacherry writes: https://t.co/2PH0fgLhkp

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The Protocols of the Elders of Zion" has outlived a mountain of other conspiratorial, anti-Semitic texts. It's not correct or even original—so why has it survived for so long? Steven J. Zipperstein explains: https://t.co/qjTweOyoRU

name: TheAtlantic
text: Senate Democrats unveiled their plan to tackle climate change, @yayitsrob reports. It uses new goals, surges of investment, and a playbook from industrial policy to decarbonize the economy. https://t.co/0iHUQPAzxA

name: TheAtlantic
text: China’s Summer of Floods—via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/no5owyMIrT

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @edyong209: "In truth, the Aaron Coleman saga... is a testament to how readily, still, conversations about abuse will focus on what is owed to the abuser."

Always read @megangarber 

https://t.co/hpK4VizKoG

name: TheAtlantic
